intro: Mesembryanthemum montaguense, commonly known as the Montagu's ice plant, is a succulent flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, characterized by its fleshy leaves and showy flowers. The plant is adapted to arid environments, storing water in its thick, fleshy leaves. It produces vibrant yellow or orange flowers that bloom in the early morning and close by midday. Mesembryanthemum montaguense is often used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements and ornamental value.
